title: IDOR in backup recovery functionality
content:
Summary
Hi team I hope you are well, there is an issue let me to takeover any backup via recover it to my machine.
Steps To Reproduce
Login https://mc-beta-cloud.acronis.com
Visit the DEVICES section [you must have 2 devices]
Click on any device has a backup [device_1]
Click on recovery > select machine > select the second machine [device_2]
follow the steps to recover the backup to [device_2]
In the burp search for this endpoint /bc/api/ams/recovery/plan_operations/run
Send the request again via X-Apigw-Session session from another organization.
POC
Impact
Backup Takeover via recovery function.
steps: Visit the DEVICES section (must have at least 2 devices)
Click on any device with a backup (device_1)
Click on recovery > select machine > select the second machine (device_2)
Follow the steps to recover the backup to device_2
In Burp, search for the endpoint /bc/api/ams/recovery/plan_operations/run
Send the request again using X-Apigw-Session from another organization
vuln_description: This is an Insecure Direct Object Reference (IDOR) vulnerability in the backup recovery functionality of Acronis Cloud. An attacker can recover any backup to their machine by manipulating the recovery process and reusing a session token from another organization.
reason: The vulnerability involves multiple steps, including understanding the backup recovery flow and session token manipulation, but the attack is straightforward once the endpoint and token reuse are identified.
